name: market for mandarin | mandarin | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19981/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represent the local market for mandarin in South Africa. Mandarins will then be sorted and graded at the sorting facilities (packhouses).;Data from Company Budget Report (Combuds), CGA (2016) and a previous study done on the soft citrus sector in South Africa (Konig, 2015)

The activity includes the transport from the farm to the packhouse facilities.

Cold store is not included since it happens after the fruit has left the packhouse. Losses are included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0123:Growing of citrus fruits

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents the local market for mandarin in South Africa. From the farm the mandarin are transported to the packhouse where they will be graded and sorted.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from Company Budget Report (Combuds), previuos study done on the Mandarin sector in South Africa (Konig, 2015), CGA 2016 and DAFF 2015
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from Company Budget Report (Combuds), previuos study done on the Mandarin sector in South Africa (Konig, 2015), CGA 2016 and DAFF 2015

exchanges.description: This represents the total produce that is transported from the farm to the packhouses.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The amount of fruit which is spoiled and thrown out during the transport between the producers and the consumers is represented by two exchanges; the additional 0.12 kg of the fruit and the same amount of biowaste created.
